description.narrative: Reprogrammed funds to mitigate the impact of COVID-19 Core support to ILAC - a network of fifty organisations working on rehabilitation of justice systems in and after conflict. ILAC is running Sida-funded programs and this core support allows ILAC to remain flexible and apt to resopnd to needs for, amongst others, country specific analyses of justice systems and to formulate recommendations for national and international actors to align with. ILAC also works to influence on policy development in the area of justice systems in conflict-affected countries. Sida includes, in the core support, funding for a specific exchange exercise between Tunisian and Palestinian representatives for the justice systems on management of tensions between secular and islamist groups and standpoints.

Omprogrammerade medel för att lindra konsekvenserna av covid-19 Kärnstöd till International Legal Assistance Consortium (ILAC) - en nätverksorganisation, med sekretariat i Sverige, för sammanslutningar av professioner inom rättsområdet på nationell eller internationell nivå. ILAC arbetar för förebyggande av återfall i konflikt genom stöd till återuppbyggnad av oberoende rättssystem och samhällen byggda på rättsstatens principer. Stödet innebär kärnstöd till ILAC, som också bedriver program finansierade av andra Sidaenheter respektive utlandsmyndigheter. Kärnstödet ger ILAC flexibilitet och möjlighet att svara upp mot behov och efterfrågan på bland annat fördjupade analyser av rättsystem i konflikt eller post-konfliktskeden samt att påverka och bidra till policyutveckling inom stöd till rättsstatsuppbyggnad i konfliktkontexter. I stödet omfattas också medel för ett specifikt utbytesprojekt mellan tunisiska och palestinska aktörer inom rättsväsendena för att möjliggöra delande av erfarenheter från den tunisiska reformprocessen med de palestinska aktörerna.

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

tag.narrative: 10.3 - Ensure equal opportunity and reduce inequalities of outcome, including by eliminating discriminatory laws, policies and practices and promoting appropriate legislation, policies and action in this regard.

10.3 - Säkerställa lika möjligheter och minska förekomsten av ojämlika utfall, bland annat genom att avskaffa diskriminerande lagstiftning, politik och praxis och främja lagstiftning, politik och åtgärder av lämpligt slag i detta hänseende.
16.1 - Avsevärt minska alla former av våld och dödligt våld överallt.
16.1 - Significantly reduce all forms of violence and related death rates everywhere.
16.2 - End abuse, exploitation, trafficking and all forms of violence against and torture of children.
16.2 - Eliminera övergrepp, utnyttjande, människohandel och alla former av våld eller tortyr mot barn.
16.3 - Främja rättssäkerheten på nationell och internationell nivå samt säkerställa lika tillgång till rättvisa för alla.
16.3 - Promote the rule of law at the national and international levels and ensure equal access to justice for all.
16.5 - Substantially reduce corruption and bribery in all their forms.
16.5 - Väsentligt minska alla former av korruption och mutor.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.
16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.7 - Säkerställa ett lyhört, inkluderande, deltagandebaserat och representativt beslutsfattande på alla nivåer.
16.7 - Ensure responsive, inclusive, participatory and representative decision-making at all levels.
5.2 - Eliminate all forms of violence against all women and girls in the public and private spheres, including trafficking and sexual and other types of exploitation.
5.2 - Avskaffa alla former av våld mot alla kvinnor och flickor i det offentliga och privata rummet, inklusive människohandel, sexuellt utnyttjande och andra typer av exploatering.

5.a - Undertake reforms to give women equal rights to economic resources, as well as access to ownership and control over land and other forms of property, financial services, inheritance and natural resources, in accordance with national laws.

5.a - Genomföra reformer för att ge kvinnor lika rätt till ekonomiska resurser, möjlighet att äga och kontrollera mark och andra former av egendom samt tillgång till finansiella tjänster, arv och naturresurser, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning

description.narrative: The annual narrative report is accompanied by an annual report from the board, two annexes for ILAC’s work in Syria and Cuba respectively as well as a financial report and audit report (see separate statements for the audit report and the financial report). The MENA report will be submitted in September, in line with the agreement conditions for this programme. For future agreements it would be better to coordinate the dates for the country reports so that they align with the core report. The year 2018 is the second year in ILAC's 5 year strategy with the vision "Equal justice for all". ILAC’s programmes encompass two regions (MENA and Latin America) and four countries (Syria, Cuba, Palestine and Tunisia). The annual report highlights several results. ILAC's Rule of Law assessment for Guatemala was published in 2018 with a series of seminars and events in Washington, New York, Stockholm and London tofollow up. ILAC has entered into a Memorandum of Understanding with their partners in Cuba, developed their work with judges in Palestine and deepened the dialogue with international actors such as UNDP, Pathfinders for Justice and G7+. Moreover, The Assessment of the Administrative Tribunal of Tunisia was conducted and finalised early 2018and its recommendations informed the design and development of a three year project by the National Center on State Courts (NCSC), an ILAC member, with the Administrative Tribunal of Tunisia. There are also several examples in the report of how ILAC were invited as experts or how the recommendations were captured or cited by local, regional or international actors.The first year on the core agreement has also provided valuable lessons. The report highlights several important conclusions that will inform ILAC’s future work. One key lessons learned is the need for more long-term focus on assessments and ILAC has thus started a process of setting out geographic priorities for the entire strategy period.Another key lesson is that there are lower transaction costs when ILAC conducts an assessment in a country where they can draw on an active programme presence. ILAC can then use existing networks and gain access to interlocutors and policy institutions, in addition to optimizing resources, knowledge and trust gained over the years in a specific country.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
